intro: Nasturtium mucronulatum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge, and its stems are hairy and trailing. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible flowers. Nasturtium mucronulatum is also valued for its ability to attract beneficial insects to the garden.
